name: Lost for Words! 11 Online Trivia | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
What name completes this song lyric?
"______, the two of us need look no more
We both found what we were looking for"
questions.explanation:
Ben.

	This song, "Ben" was a Motown hit for Michael Jackson in 1972.  A US chart topper, "Ben" peaked at #7 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Like a bat out of hell I'll be gone when the ______ comes 
When the night is over 
Like a bat out of hell
I'll be gone, gone, gone"
At what time of the day does this man get moving?
questions.explanation:
morning.

	Meat Loaf hit the charts with "Bat Out Of Hell" in the UK in 1979.  "Bat Out Of Hell", from the album of the same name, was written by Jim Steinman.

questions.text:
"It's the honky tonk ______ 
Gimme, gimme, gimme the honky tonk blues"
Which word fills the blank in this Rolling Stones lyric?
questions.explanation:
woman & women.

	"Honky Tonk Women", written by Mick Jagger and Keith Richards, was a 1969 for The Rolling Stones.  This track, which topped the US and UK charts, featured on the album "Get Yer Ya-Ya's Out".

questions.text:
"Some boys try and some boys lie 
But I don't let them play - no way
Only boys that save their pennies
Make my ______ day"
What's the weather forecast for this song?
questions.explanation:
rainy.

	These lyrics are from Madonna's "Material Girl". This song peaked at #3 in the UK charts in 1985.

questions.text:
"But the biggest kick I ever got
Was doing a thing called the Crocodile Rock
While the other kids were Rocking Round the ______
We were hopping and bopping to the Crocodile Rock"
What are they rocking around?
questions.explanation:
clock.

	Elton John, real name Reginald Dwight, wrote the music for "Crocodile Rock".  The lyrics were written by Bernie Taupin. This 1972 song was a US chart topper peaking at #5 in the UK.  "Crocodile Rock" features on the album "Don't Shoot Me I'm Only The Piano Player".

questions.text:
"Went to a dance looking for ______
Saw Barbara Ann so I thought I'd take a chance" 
What were the Beach Boys looking for at this terpsichorean event?
questions.explanation:
romance.

	These lyrics are from the Beach Boys 1966 hit "Barbara Ann".  A Fred Fassert composition the song peaked at #3 in the UK.

questions.text:
"I'll buy you a ______ ring my friend 
If it makes you feel all right 
I'll get you anything my friend 
If it makes you feel all right"
So what type of ring was it?
questions.explanation:
diamond.

	A Lennon/McCartney composition "Can't Buy Me Love" hit the pop charts for the Beatles in 1964.  "Can't Buy Me Love" topped the charts in both the US and the UK.

questions.text:
"Sailors fighting in the ______ hall
Oh man! Look at those cavemen go
It's the freakiest show"
Where did the fracas occur?
questions.explanation:
dance.

	Lyrics from "Life On Mars" by David Bowie, real name David Jones.  This track peaked at #3 in the UK charts when released in 1973.

questions.text:
"You can't ______ love 
No, you just have to wait 
She said love don't come easy 
It's a game of give and take"
Just what can't you do with love?
questions.explanation:
hurry.

	"Can't Hurry Love" is a classic 1966 Motown hit from the Supremes.  A US chart topper this song peaked at #3 in the UK.

questions.text:
"And then I go and spoil it all
By saying something ______ 
Like, I love you"
So were the words wise, romantic or foolish?
questions.explanation:
stupid.

	These words come from the Frank and Nancy Sinatra song "Something Stupid".  Released in 1967 this father and daughter duo topped both the US and UK charts with this track.
